function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"COVID-19 bringing new challenges and opportunities for public and social housing sectors","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission within housing environments","Mitigation":"Implementing strict sanitation and hygiene protocols, promoting social distancing measures, and providing adequate healthcare resources","Technologies":"Sanitization equipment, contactless technology for access and communication, ventilation systems","People":"Residents of public and social housing, housing policy makers, researchers","Owner":"Government agencies, housing authorities, research institutions"},{"Description":"Rapid housing policy making taking place in many countries due to COVID-19","Impact":"Potential for inadequate consideration of health and disease transmission in policy decisions","Mitigation":"Incorporating public health expertise into housing policy development, conducting thorough risk assessments, and integrating pandemic-informed design principles","Technologies":"Health data analytics, simulation models for disease spread, telecommuting infrastructure","People":"Housing policy makers, public health experts, researchers","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations, research institutions"},{"Description":"Systematic literature mapping methodological article with relevance for COVID-19 housing policy making","Impact":"Risk of overlooking key evidence and research in rapid housing policy development","Mitigation":"Encouraging the use of systematic literature mapping to inform evidence-based housing policy making, promoting collaboration between scholars and policy makers, and ensuring ongoing review of emerging research","Technologies":"Data mining and analysis tools, collaboration platforms, digital publication repositories","People":"Housing policy makers, researchers, scholars, practitioners","Owner":"Research institutions, academic publishers, housing policy organizations"}]}
